alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains; Okanogan Highlands; Okanogan Valley; Spokane Area; Upper Columbia Basin; Waterville Plateau (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 6:46PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Douglas, northeastern Adams, Lincoln, northwestern Stevens, Ferry, southeastern Okanogan and northeastern Grant Counties through 745 PM PDT... At 645 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a gust front along a line extending from Republic to Coulee City to Odessa. Movement was west at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Gusty winds ahead of the onset of rain could result in localized blowing dust in the Columbia Basin and Waterville Plateau. Locations impacted include... Colville, Sherman Pass, Nespelem Community, Lincoln, Kettle Falls, Coulee Dam, Republic, Grand Coulee, Electric City, Odessa, Wilbur, Harrington, Almira, Elmer City, Nespelem, Creston, Marcus, Hartline, Krupp, and Davis Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 in Washington between mile markers 230 and 242. U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 194 and 246. U.S. Highway 395 in Washington between mile markers 231 and 255. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Mountains; Okanogan Highlands; Okanogan Valley; Spokane Area; Upper Columbia Basin; Waterville Plateau
